description: From Middle English governesse, a contracted form of governeresse, from Old French governeresse (“female ruler or administrator”).

entries.meaning: A woman paid to educate children in their own home.

verbs.description: governess (third-person singular simple present governesses, present participle governessing, simple past and past participle governessed)

entries.meaning: To work as governess; to educate children in their own home.
